Photo / DoC
Beggar groups travel to Rotorua to make up to $400 a day from ‘generous’ locals https://www.nzherald.co.nz/rotorua-daily-post/news/beggar-groups-travel-to-rotorua-to-make-up-to-400-a-day-from-generous-locals/ QTRCFGRNPNFEBG3ZKN2NZSS7PQ/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/rotorua-daily-post/news/beggar-groups-travel-to-rotorua-to-make-up-to-400-a-day-from-generous-locals/ QTRCFGRNPNFEBG3ZKN2NZSS7PQ/ Kelly Makiha'It’s the easiest way to get a something when you got a nothing without having to steal.' Dunedin boy Cooper McLennan given chance to run on world stage in Denmark https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/dunedin-boy-cooper-mclennan-given-chance-to-run-on-world-stage-in-denmark/RKXUCGGGBRFNFD7R4LC22PFMHY/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/dunedin-boy-cooper-mclennan-given-chance-to-run-on-world-stage-in-denmark/RKXUCGGGBRFNFD7R4LC22PFMHY/ Laine Priestley10-year-old Cooper went from a sport-filled life playing futsal to being wheelchair-bound. Fri, 16 Feb 2024 19:47:04 +0000 Cooper McLennan was diagnosed in 2020 with Perthes’ disease, which stopped him from participating in sports. Inset top right: Cooper with sisters Isabella, 13, Hazel, 1, mum Jalisa and dad Chris. Inset below: An x-ray of Cooper’s hip.
